newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle trade at standstill-feedlots.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle trade at standstill-feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains direct cattle markets were at a standstill near midday Thursday, with packers and cattle owners still $2.00 per cwt apart in their bids and asking levels, feedlot sources said.
Packers continued to bid $70.00, with asking levels at a firm $72.00--steady with last week's top prices, sources said.
"No one is going to sell for less than $72.00...that's a given," said a Texas Panhandle feedlot manager.
Cattle owners' firm pricing stance stemmed from ideas that packers were short of live cattle and need to come into the market soon to replenish stocks for slaughter.
